statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.description: Brandon Brown hit 9 of 11 field goal attempts for 21 points while dishing out six assists as Loyola Marymount held off Pacific 79-73 on Thursday night.
article.headline: Loyola Marymount holds off Pacific for 79-73 win
article.linkText: Loyola Marymount holds off Pacific for 79-73 win
article.story: LOS ANGELES -- Brandon Brown hit 9 of 11 field goal attempts for 21 points while dishing out six assists as Loyola Marymount held off Pacific 79-73 on Thursday night. Trevor Manuel and Steven Haney added 11 apiece for Loyola Marymount (10-10, 3-6 West Coast Conference). Ten of LMU's last 17 games have been decided in the last 10 seconds with six being one-point decisions. The Lions had a little easier time of it against Pacific, as they never trailed in the second half. However Pacific tied the game three times in the final period. Brown drilled a 3-pointer to spark a 9-0 run and give the Lions a 58-48 lead with 8:02 left. Pacific rallied to close to 67-66 after T.J. Wallace hit a jumper with 3:20 remaining. Manuel responded with a jump shot and LMU held on for the win. Ray Bowles led Pacific (8-14, 2-7) with 22 points.
